subject: Delegation of Power for revision of the costs of preconstruction activities (Land Acquisition; Utility Shifting; etc.) for on-going projects.
text: IRav 7zty TTHTif qifearut 744 IPhone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (37 4Raav 3k_{rjHTf tTT4) Wq / Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) vif-5 & 6, Taer-10, ERaT, # ferit-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka Delhi-110075 NHAI/Policy Guidelines/Delegation of Power/Land Acquisition/2019 Policy Circular No. 7.1.63/2019 Dated I8" November, 2019 (Decision taken in Special Meeting of the Authority held on 01.10.2019 vide Agenda Items 143.02 & 143.09) Subject Delegation of Power for revision of the costs of preconstruction activities (Land Acquisition, Utility Shifting, etc.) for on-going projects. Prior to approval of Bharatmala Pariyojna, the projects of NHAI have been approved for award on completion of publication of 3(A) notification for 90% Of work-front required and publication of 3(D) notification for 60% of the work-front required, as per the decision taken in the 56th meeting of PPPAC held on 21st December 2012, which is as under: "atleast 60% of the total land should be available or  notification under Section 3(A) should have been issued for atleast 90% of the land required and notification under Section 3(D) should have been issued for atleast 60% of the land required for the project:" 2 The cost of land acquisition is determined by circle rates/ transactions in the area for the last 3 years and applicable provisions of the Act for calculation of award amount: The actual land awards, which are received in due course of time are sometimes at variance to the estimated cost (normally higher than the estimated cost). Various utility owning agencies take lot of time in submitting the estimates, which goes in parallel during the stage of project implementation. The costs of these activities are determined by other Govt_ Dept. / Agencies resulting in variance in the estimated cost and the actual expenditure on shifting of utilities. There are number of cases where actual costs of   land  acquisition and other pre- construction activities like utility shifting, forest clearance, tree cutting, etc. as per actuals have exceeded the estimated costs. 3 At present; NHAI's ROs have been delegated with powers for approving land acquisition and utility shifting costs, as per project requirements, which are not limited to the estimated provisions. There are no specific guidelines for regularization of increase in expenditure of pre-construction activities of already approved & on-going projects. 4.
